did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Archives and Special Collections Department, L. Douglas Wilder Library, Virginia Union University
did.unittitle:
The Records of Community Learning Week
1979-1998
did.physdesc: This collection is 24 linear feet in size.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The Records of Community Learning Week, Accession #AR-0006, Archives and Special Collections Department, L. Douglas Wilder Library, Virginia Union University

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: These records reflect the activities and events of Community Learning Week (CLW) at Virginia Union University and in the Richmond community. CLW was organized in 1979 by the Richmond Committee of Black Clergy and the Office of Student Development at Virginia Union University. Rev. T.C. Milner headed the clergy group and Dr. Grace Pleasants directed the Virginia Union University office. The intent was to bring together the community to honor the memory and mission of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Pleasants served as program coordinator with Milner assisting until 1983 when Milner became program director. The week-long celebration includes a Community Leaders Breakfast and educational and cultural events throughout the city.
